item.title: Grass verge destroyed by HGVs , builders trucks …, 26th February
item.description:
As you can see , yet again on Hawthorne Road the lovely grass verge on the pavement is being destroyed by HGVs parking all over the payment showing scant regard for the preservation on our road … this has happened many times before the length of the road .. and is further exasperated by NON RESIDENTS PARKING for free to use Bickley station meaning the width of the road is seriously reduced during the working week . Please once again look at litigants to sort this out once and for all .. as a resident getting royally hacked off with this state of affairs ! Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hawthorne Road, Bickley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeding areas around Grainger Court, entrances, 26th February
item.description:
I hope you can help. The concrete areas around Grainger Court, SE5 0LX and its two entrances on Councillor Street and Redcar Street need weeding BUT they also need serious pressure washing or people to come with the right equipment to dig out the soil, moss and weeds which have developed in the cracks between the concrete surfaces and out of which the weeds grow in the first place. They're slippery and unsightly. Please note there are two entrances to the block and a central courtyard which is often missed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Councillor Street, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish thrown in behind house 15 along the walkway and steps down from Cresent Road...it's awful looking and I have seen people dumping bags of rubbish there, 26th February
item.description:
This is absolutely disgusting I witnessed two women dumping bags of rubbish into this area, I don't know them as I'm a new resident here, it looks terrible and there are many bins available along the street do why are these people dumping in this area .. perhaps wireless cameras would help catch the perpetrators of this disgusting illegal dumping

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ruddstreet Close, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dustman leaving bins on road & leaving height restriction open always., 26th February
item.description:
Dustman leaving bins on road & leaving height restriction open always. They are very lazy. Sometimes they cannot back their truck in but it is a private car park and they have no right. Leaving the bins by the road is very childish. They always leave the height restrictions open even though they are closed when they arrive. I have to shut them all the time. We do this to stop big vehicles coming along and dumping rubbish everywhere.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Abbey Road, Lessness Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog mess all over the pavement, 26th February
item.description:
There’s dog mess along the pavement which has been stepped in and spread all over the path, needs cleaning up. Seems dog owners like this stretch of path for their dogs to do there business
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maiden Lane, Barnes Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: At the rear of Reachview Close along the towpath., 26th February
item.description:
We have been asked by the property management company of Reachview Close to carry out some tree work in a parcel of land that runs along one of the boundaries between the flats and the canal at Baynes Street Canalside Garden. Some trees are overhanging the flats.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Regent's Canal towpath, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water streaming over pavement, 26th February
item.description:
